entity1.name: Sharks
entity1.description: A group of fish with a cartilaginous skeleton, known for their predatory behavior and keen senses.;;;A group of fish with a cartilaginous skeleton, known for their predatory behavior and ability to sense the movements of other marine life.;;;A group of fish known for their acute sense of smell and predatory behavior.;;;A group of fish that have evolved over millions of years to become efficient predators in the marine ecosystem.;;;A group of cartilaginous fish known for their predatory behavior and highly developed sensory systems.;;;A large predatory shark known for its size and power, often found in coastal surface waters.;;;A large marine predator known for its keen sense of smell.;;;A group of cartilaginous fish known for their predatory behavior and sensory capabilities.;;;A group of fish with a cartilaginous skeleton, known for their predatory behavior in the ocean.;;;A group of fish with cartilaginous skeletons and powerful jaws, known for their predatory behavior.;;;A group of fish known for their predatory capabilities and sensory abilities that help them navigate the ocean.;;;A group of fish with a cartilaginous skeleton, known for their predatory behavior and sensory adaptations.;;;A group of fish with a cartilaginous skeleton, known for their predatory behavior and well-developed sensory systems.;;;A group of cartilaginous fish characterized by a streamlined body, powerful jaws, and sharp teeth.;;;A group of fish with a cartilaginous skeleton, known for their predatory behavior and specialized sensory systems.;;;A group of fish characterized by a cartilaginous skeleton, five to seven gill slits on the sides of the head, and pectoral fins that are not fused to the head.;;;A group of fish with a cartilaginous skeleton, known for their predatory behavior and sensitive sensory systems.;;;A group of fish known for their cartilaginous skeletons, powerful jaws, and predatory behavior.
entity1.chunkid: How Sharks Detect Prey10;;;How Sharks Detect Prey12;;;How Sharks Detect Prey7;;;How Sharks Detect Prey17;;;How Sharks Detect Prey21;;;How Sharks Detect Prey8;;;How Sharks Detect Prey3;;;How Sharks Detect Prey18;;;How Sharks Detect Prey20;;;How Sharks Detect Prey1;;;How Sharks Detect Prey4;;;How Sharks Detect Prey6;;;How Sharks Detect Prey19;;;How Sharks Detect Prey14;;;How Sharks Detect Prey16;;;How Sharks Detect Prey5;;;How Sharks Detect Prey23;;;How Sharks Detect Prey9;;;How Sharks Detect Prey11;;;How Sharks Detect Prey15

entity2.name: marine ecosystem
entity2.description: The aquatic environment where organisms, including sharks, live and interact with each other and their surroundings.;;;A natural environment where organisms live in water, such as oceans, seas, rivers, and lakes.
entity2.chunkid: How Sharks Detect Prey21;;;How Sharks Detect Prey1

entity3.name: hunters
entity3.description: Individuals who pursue and catch animals, typically for food or sport.

entity4.name: prey
entity4.description: Animals that are hunted or caught by predators as food.;;;Animals that are hunted and eaten by predators such as sharks.;;;An animal that is hunted and eaten by another animal, often referred to as predators.;;;Animals that are hunted or caught by predators for food.;;;Animals that are hunted by other animals for food.;;;An animal that is hunted by another for food.
entity4.chunkid: How Sharks Detect Prey4;;;How Sharks Detect Prey8;;;How Sharks Detect Prey14;;;How Sharks Detect Prey21;;;How Sharks Detect Prey18;;;How Sharks Detect Prey2;;;How Sharks Detect Prey20

entity6.name: ocean
entity6.description: The vast body of saltwater that covers most of the Earth's surface, providing a habitat for marine life.;;;A large body of saltwater that covers approximately 71% of Earth's surface, providing a habitat for a diverse range of marine life.
entity6.chunkid: How Sharks Detect Prey23;;;How Sharks Detect Prey3

entity10.name: olfactory system
entity10.description: The sensory system used by animals to detect and process odors, which is particularly well-developed in sharks for detecting chemicals in water.

entity12.name: Olympic-sized swimming pool
entity12.description: A large swimming pool built to the specifications set by the International Olympic Committee, typically used for competitive swimming events.

entity13.name: olfactory bulbs
entity13.description: A part of the brain involved in processing and analyzing scents.

entity18.name: lateral line system
entity18.description: A sensory organ found in aquatic animals that detects movement and vibrations in the surrounding water, aiding in navigation and prey detection.;;;A system of sense organs in aquatic vertebrates that detects movement and pressure changes in the surrounding water.
entity18.chunkid: How Sharks Detect Prey19;;;How Sharks Detect Prey9

entity20.name: fish
entity20.description: Aquatic vertebrates that live in water and breathe through gills, often serving as prey for larger predators like sharks.

entity21.name: marine animals
entity21.description: A diverse group of organisms that inhabit the marine environment, including various species of fish, mammals, and invertebrates.

entity23.name: electrical signals
entity23.description: Electromagnetic fields or impulses that can be detected by certain organisms as part of their sensory adaptations.;;;Electrical fields are regions around charged particles where a force can be detected.
entity23.chunkid: How Sharks Detect Prey13;;;How Sharks Detect Prey11

entity25.name: ampullae of Lorenzini
entity25.description: A network of electroreceptor organs in sharks and rays, used to detect electric fields in water for navigation and hunting.

entity26.name: cells
entity26.description: Cells are the basic structural and functional units of living organisms.

entity28.name: muscles
entity28.description: Muscles are contractile tissues in animals that produce movement and maintain posture.

entity29.name: nerves
entity29.description: Nerves are bundles of fibers that transmit signals between the brain, spinal cord, and other parts of the body.

entity30.name: animals
entity30.description: Animals are multicellular eukaryotic organisms that form the biological kingdom Animalia.

entity35.name: eyes
entity35.description: The visual organs that allow sharks to see in low light conditions and murky waters.

entity37.name: tapetum lucidum
entity37.description: A layer of tissue behind the retina that reflects light back through the retina, enhancing vision in low-light conditions.

entity47.name: smell
entity47.description: The ability to detect odors or scents through the nose.

entity48.name: hearing
entity48.description: The ability to perceive sound by detecting vibrations via an organ such as the ear.

entity49.name: electroreception
entity49.description: The ability to detect electrical impulses or fields, often found in aquatic animals.

entity50.name: vision
entity50.description: The ability to perceive the visible spectrum of light and see images through the eyes.

entity51.name: touch
entity51.description: The ability to sense physical contact or pressure on the skin.

entity54.name: marine food chain
entity54.description: The hierarchical structure in marine ecosystems where organisms are grouped into trophic levels based on their feeding relationships and energy transfer.
